titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 84
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Cantus sororum - antiphonary for the Birgittine sisters

supportDesc.foliation: There are two sets of pagination and one set of foliation: modern pagination in pencil, beginning on : 1-126; modern pagination in pencil, beginning on : 1-124; modern foliation in pencil, beginning on : 1-62.

p.note: Top left corner: National Library book label with the current signum in black ink. Centre page: bookplate of Prince Borghese. Various notes in pencil by modern hands, from top to bottom: Borghesiska katalogen P. 2.1892; Antiphonarium s. 1-103; Hymnarium 104-119; L 2. (signavit Blume); Photostatiskt reproducerad 30 maj-1 juni 1921 för fil. lic. Matts Åmark; in ink: Antiphonarium och Hymnarium sanctae Birgittae. Inköpt Febr. 1893 på Prins Borgheses bokauktion i Rom. - No. 938 i auktionskatalogen.
Centre page: bookplate of Prince Borghese.
Top right in pencil by modern hand: ma; bottom right in pencil by modern hand: z.

binding.p: 19th-century binding. Brown leather over medieval wooden boards. 4 double raised bands and 2 end-bands. 2 pin clasps attached to leather straps going from the . , stamped in gold: A 84.

decoNote.p: 2-line blind tooling along the outer edges of the volume, creating a panel which is further divided by 2-line tooling in the form of an X.

binding.condition: Binding shows signs of wear. Cracking along the spine. The original brown leather straps still extant but have been reinforced with a new pair of tighter, white straps, in 1975. On , signs of rust (?) from the nails attaching the straps.

origin.p:
15th century, second half. Origin unknown. According to Nilsson (1992)
, the hymn melodies seem to conform to the Swedish tradition and she claims the hand is not Italian, but Servatius (1990)
, does not rule out an Italian origin.

provenance.p:
Belonged to the Borghese family, see bookplate of Marcantonio V Borghese on . Earlier provenance is unknown but Geete (1895)
suggests the Birgittine monastery Paradiso near Florence, as does Servatius (1990)
, who also mentions Scala Coeli in Genoa or a house in Valencia as other possibilities.

acquisition.p: Purchased by the National Library of Sweden in Rome, in February at the book auction of Paolo Borghese, Prince of Sulmona, see addition on . The auction catalogue number mentioned there does not correspond to the number in the Borghese auction catalogue , where it is listed as no. 4564.

msItem.title: Prayers and lesson
Prayers
msItem.incipit: Deus cuius claritatis fulgore beatus michael
msItem.explicit: ut cuius gloriam predicamus in terris ipsius precibus adiuuemur in celis. per.

msItem.title: Lesson
msItem.incipit: In diebus illis. Factum est prelium magnum in celo michael et angeli eius preliabantur cum dracone (Rev. 12:7)
msItem.explicit: Proiectus est in terram et angeli eius cum illo missi sunt Et a

msItem.note: This leaf is a fragment, containing two full prayers and the beginning of a lesson.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink. Rubrics in red. Capitals touched in red.

decoNote.p: Plain initials over 2-4 lines with interior reserved shapes. The two initials on have some flourishing in blue and red, also in the counter space. Hanging I in red with interior reserved shapes over 4 lines, on .

msItem.title: Antiphons for the Office
msItem.incipit: Trinum deum et vnum pronis mentibus adoremus
msItem.explicit: Funde preces tuo nato ihesu christo uulnerato pro nobis et flagellato spinis sputo felle potato. O dulcis Maria.

msItem.title: Antiphons for Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: Regina celi letare alleluya quia quem meruisti portare alleluya
msItem.explicit: et benedictus fructus ventris tui in eternum versus alleluya
msItem.note: Both antiphons, Regina celi leta and Ave maria, are followed by alleluya.

msItem.title: Benedicamus tropes
msItem.incipit: Benedicamus virginis filio alleluya alleluya alleluya
msItem.explicit: Benedicamus domino alleluya. Deo gracias alleluya.

msItem.title: Hymns
msItem.rubric: In dominica ad matutinas super nocturnam ymnus
msItem.incipit: O Trinitatis gloria celestis decus curie sponsa regis altissimi
msItem.explicit: trinum deum glorificet pro te tam digna laudibus Maria mater gracie Gloria tibi domino.

msItem.title: Suffrages for St Birgitta
msItem.incipit: Rosa rorans bonitatem stella stillans claritatem
msItem.explicit: Domine deus noster qui secundum magnam misericordiam tuam beate Birgitte tantam dedisti gratiam et regnat in unitate spiritus sancti deus. Per omnia secula seculorum. Amen. Versus. Domine exaudi orationem meam. Responsorium. Et clamor meus ad te ueniat et cetera
msItem.note: The two antiphons, Rosa rorans and Gaude Birgitta, are set to music but in reverse order from Geete's edition. The collect following Rosa rorans is in Geete placed after Gaude Birgitta. The collect following the latter is not in Geete.

supportDesc.condition:
Some holes in the parchment have been repaired before the production of the book, see e.g. . Pages have been trimmed resulting in some loss of text, see .The pages are dirty and worn in the lower outer corners, some of which have been repaired, see e.g.
. Some corners missing, no loss of text.

p.note: Upper margin near outer corner in black ink by an early modern (?) hand: Carte. LXI. Above in black ink: R (?).

decoDesc.p: Notation and text in black ink. Capitals touched in red. Staves and rubrics in red.

decoNote.p:
: Puzzle initial T over the entire stave and the text line, in blue and red with red flourishing in the counterspace. : Plain initials over the entire stave in alternating colours: red, black and blue. Some have reserved interior shapes (e.g. ), some are both black and red with some flourishing or drawing in the counterspace (e.g.
). : Plain initials over the entire stave in alternating blue and red ink, sometimes with flourishing in contrasting colour (e.g. ). Plain capital letters in alternating blue and red. : Flourished initials over two lines in alternating blue and red ink with flourishes in contrasting colour.

msItem.title: Antiphons and responsories
msItem.rubric: Festo annuntiationis dominice ad sextam et nonam subscripte antiphone habeantur
msItem.explicit: Exulta reuerenda mater de reuerendissima filia tua que eum uirgo genuit qui omnia creauit Gloria patri et filio et spiritu sancto
msItem.note: These two pages are a fragment containing Birgittine antiphons and responsories for the feasts of the Annnunciation, the Trinity, St Michael and St Anne. On only the first stave has music and text.

p.note: Two modern additions in pencil, probably referring to another manuscript.

decoDesc.p: Notation and text in black ink. Staves and rubrics in red. Plain initials in red and blue over 2 lines with reserved interior lines.
